item.title: Rationality and normative inversion
item.description: In chapter 2 of @jsaideepak ’s book, he draws our attention to the concepts of Modernity and Rationality that were used by the European colonizers as whetstones for validity of concepts and practices. Interesting to see this normative inversion with respect to Lindy’s Principle. You might have come across statements like “This is the 21st century. Why are you still sporting a religious mark on your forehead?” The hidden assumption here is that sporting religious marks is a pre-modern practice.
